result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Monty Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court Costs = $518.00  including DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.
AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations
Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Monty Smith

records.addlTxt:
10:52 AM Defendant Charles Monty Smith in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Charles Monty Smith.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.Court calls case and recites appearances. Plea Questionnaire submitted to Court.   State recites agreement, all parties agree.  Court reviews the information, DEF enters Guilty plea to Count 1.  DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea to Count 2 and finds DEF guilty.  Count 1 is dismissed and read in.   State makes statement prior to sentencing.  Court finds Victim Rights Legislation has been complied with.   Attny Chapman makes statement prior to sentencing.  DEF no comment.  Court addresses DEF, DEF responds as to tardiness.    Court follows agreement.  

COURT;  withheld sentence:  2 years probation.  Conditions of probation:  AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.  Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through.  Court costs including DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.   9 days jail credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

OFF THE RECORD / 11:19AM - Defendant Charles Monty Smith in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Charles Monty Smith. Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Chapman requests PLEAS.  Court sets PLEAS for 6/27/22 at 10:30AM.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on June 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

12:00PM Defendant Charles Monty Smith in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.    Atty Chapman waived prelim.  Court advised the DEF as to his right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  State indicates Information was previously filed.  Atty Chapman wishes to proceed to ARGN.  Atty Chapman acknowledges information, waives reading, enters NG pleas on behalf of DEF.  Court receives NG pleas, finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.  Court sets STC for 6/7/22 at 11AM.  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Arraignment on April 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Waiver of Prelim on April 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:12 AM Defendant Charles Monty Smith in court by video with attorney Daniel James Chapman appears by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.    DEF received copy of criminal complaint.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Atty Chapman indicates waiver of preliminary hearing, Court sets for waiver for next hearing.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Arraignment scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
CASH BOND RETURNED FROM JAIL MARKED REFUSED AS DEFENDANT REFUSED TO SIGN BOND.

11:23 AM  Defendant Charles Smith in court, in custody appears by video.  Attny Gabriel Pollak (special appearance) in court by video  Kenneth  Sortedahl appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Probable Cause found by court. DE doest  qualify for PD appointment.   State makes bond recommendation.  Attny Pollak argues bond.   Court sets bond.   CBS $500    ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.    INITIAL APPEARANCE set for   January 25, 2022  @ 8:30 AM
